alert.note: Alert for Harris; Waller (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 8:34AM CDT until May 17 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road affecting Harris and Waller Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Katy-Hockley Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 157.3 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage as water escapes the main channel and spills into the floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 156.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 157.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 157.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 156.9 feet on 03/30/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Cypress Creek Katy-Hockley Roa 157.3 156.8 Mon 7 pm CDT 157.2 155.3 153.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
